result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dakota Jacob POHL

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in these charges, the defendant entered pleas in Case Files 15 CF 436, 15 CF 571, 15 CF 671 and 16 CF 49.   Motion granted.  
Minutes.
Plea date on June 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea Date set for 06-02-2016 at 2:00 p.m., Br. 2.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Bail Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the bail bond previously rendered herein shall be amended from no contact with Miranda Hansen to the defendant is allowed contact with Miranda Hansen for the purpose of visiting and caring for his recently born baby girl, A. R. P., DOB: 03-25-2016 under the supervision of any grandparent of A.R.P., DOB: 03-25-2016.
Copy delivered to jail.

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Notice of Motion; Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 02-03-16 at 10:00 a.m.  Plea date is set for 06-01-16 at 1:30 p.m..   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 01-08-16 at 9:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts felony bail jumping, 2 counts battery-dvo, disorderly conduct-dvo and criminal damage to property.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-02-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $3,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with 947 S. 37th Street, Manitowoc, WI.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
